messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Hizen Handbook
messages.msgSnippet: Just published, but since Harry did it all, I guess his backyard is the place of publication. This was pretty much a cottage industry kind of thing. Gordon ...
messages.messageBody:
Just published, but since Harry did it all, I guess his backyard is the
place of publication. This was pretty much a cottage industry kind of thing.

Gordon
-----Original Message-----
From: David Zincavage [mailto:jdz@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 01, 2003 10:49 AM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Hizen Handbook


Thank you. I am correct in thinking your translation was actually just
published very recently, right? And Tokyo would be the place of
publication, I presume?

The concept of an auspicious day is pleasant to think of.



----- Original Message -----
From: Gordon Robson
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, June 30, 2003 4:49 PM
Subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Hizen Handbook


Hi David,

Published by JSSUS, and yes, the translation was done a long time ago.
Kichijitsu = auspicious day as in sword signatures.

Gordon
-----Original Message-----
From: David Zincavage [mailto:jdz@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 01, 2003 8:27 AM
To: token_kenkyu_kai@...; nihonto@...;
nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] Hizen Handbook


My copy of Mr. Robson translation of Eguchi's Hizento Hikkei arrived
today
from Mr. Watson. I find it necessary to keep a list of the titles I
own
(senility) to keep from ordering duplicates, and when I was entering
this
book on my list, I found no publisher, place, or date of publication
listed.

My impression is that the JSS/US was the publisher, is that correct?
Mr.
Robson refers to "an auspicious day" in 1997. This just appeared, did
it
not?

What, by the way, is the Japanese for "auspicious day?"



Yahoo! Groups Sponsor

Thank you. I am correct in thinking your translation was actually just published very recently, right? And Tokyo would be the place of publication, I presume?

The concept of an auspicious day is pleasant to think of.
